revised_title: Wideband Local Networks: Microwave-Frequency Carriers on Optical Fibres
tldr: This article discusses the use of microwave-frequency carriers in wideband optical-fibre networks, offering a new approach to distribute voice, data, and video services to subscribers. The authors describe the general features and design rules of microwave-multiplexed wideband optical-fibre systems and report on several specific systems developed at GTE Laboratories. They also propose design rules for fibre-optic systems and describe transmission experiments to verify these rules.
